title: Kaposi's sarcoma responding to topical imiquimod 5% cream: a case report
patient: A 57-year-old HIV negative Mediterranean man was treated with imiquimod 5% cream for purple maculo-papular cutaneous lesions on the leg that were histologically consistent with KS (papillary dermal proliferation of small angulated vessels lined by bland endothelial cells with an accompanying sparse infiltrate of lymphocytes and plasma cells).\nThe treatment protocol consisted of 3 weekly applications (Monday, Thursday, Saturday) under occlusion for at least 10 hours (between 10 and 12 hours). During the first week, the three applications were applied by the patient under supervision then the cream was self-administered for the following applications. The tolerance was good with no side effects. After twenty weeks, the purple maculo-papular lesions cleared (complete clinical response). Six months later the patient is still disease free.
